info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 28 at 11:29PM EDT until August 29 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following counties, Davie and Rowan. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams and other poor-drainage areas, including farmland, parks, greenways, boat-access areas, golf courses, underpasses, and parking lots. Isolated, shallow flows over roadways is possible. A few flood- prone, low-water crossings may become impassible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1118 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicates that the heavy rain responsible for rapid rises on area streams, including Fourth Creek, Beaverdam Branch, and Third Creek, has ended. Storm- total rainfall of 2-3 inches of rain fell in less than 2 hours this evening, resulting in nuisance flooding in low- lying areas adjacent to streams across the Advisory area. Light to moderate rainfall will persist over the next hour before gradually dissipating. However, it will take at least a couple more hours for area streams to crest and a few more hours for larger streams, including Fourth Creek, to fall back below bankfull. Therefore, a nuisance flood threat will persist into the overnight hours. Please stay away from all area streams and avoid any flooded roadways, which can be very difficult to see at night. Areas under the greatest threat for continued flooding include near Mt Vernon Rd, Hart Rd, Cool Springs Rd, Carlson Rd, S River Church Rd, and Powell Rd. - Additional heavy rainfall is possible later tonight. Given saturated soils, any new periods of heavy rainfall may cause new flood concerns to develop quickly. Please stay weather aware and be prepared to seek higher ground if you are in an area vulnerable to flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Cooleemee, Cleveland and Woodleaf. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
